subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Crystal radio technique
author: Stefan Bion
full_text:
Hi all,

I remember that someone had selled a "raudive diode" build into a microphone plug, which is very similar to a crystal radio. It shouldn't be difficult to solder a diode, 2 resistors and 2 capacitors into a plug and test it. The schematic is here: http://www.worlditc.org/c_04_s_bridge_10.htm

BTW, can anyone recommend a (tested) schematic for a simple random bit generator that can be connected to the LPT port? It should be able to deliver about 10,000 random bits (TTL level) per second. I'd like to add an option for connecting an external 'hardware' random number generator to EVPmaker.

Stefan

P.S.: A new EVPmaker version is available for download on my website:
http://www.stefanbion.de/evpmaker/
It has some additions as for instance 2 new random sources (Internet and "manual sweep"), and a new "live audio source" mode.

--

> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Ray" <evp_hgte@...> wrote:
> >
> > Has anyone tried wiring a crystal radio set into input mic jack on pc 
> > I've an idea that this could be tried using EVPmaker to boost input 
> > signal.  Any other ideas regarding crystal radio anyone.
> >
> Ray,
> 
> I have recently built a Raudive detector into a metal 1/8 inch phone
> jack for a friend, using surface mount coil and 1/8 watt resistor with
> a regular crystal diode. This is basically an untuned crystal radio
> and detects all radio signals at the same time.
> 
> I didn't get anything but noise for the short time I had it...but my
> friend is happy.
> 
> Joe
